‘Nanny state’: Council proposes fizzy drink ban at sports stadium https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/nanny-state-council-proposes-fizzy-drink-ban-at-sports-spadium/nh7a6xorf5c6hjvngqypnbgb74/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/nanny-state-council-proposes-fizzy-drink-ban-at-sports-spadium/nh7a6xorf5c6hjvngqypnbgb74/ Neil ReidCouncil claims fizzy ban at sports ground could improve the health of locals and visitors. Sat, 01 Feb 2025 16:00:00 +0000 Health officials back a council bid to ban some fizzy and sugary drinks from Central Energy Trust Arena, but it is a move some residents have hit out including one who has labelled it a step towards a "nanny state". Photo / Supplied

Kiwi landlords say their Auckland property manager stopped paying them rental income https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/kiwi-landlords-say-their-auckland-property-manager-manager-stopped-paying-them-them-rental-income/pxloir5sfnfnfnfnfnfnfpfpfpfpfdfbav2xnxnxnxwelm/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/kiwi-landlords-say-their-auckland-property-manager-manager-stopped-paying-them-them-rental-income/pxloir5sfnfnfnfnfnfnfpfpfpfpfdfbav2xnxnxnxwelm/ Ben LeahyHaven Living sent payment receipts for months, but says it has now repaid money owed. Sat, 01 Feb 2025 16:00:00 +0000 Hong Kong-based Kiwis Matt McDonnell and Alia Fong said their former property manager Haven Living Management stopped paying them rental income from their Auckland house for five months last year.
